result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Zychowicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John A Zychowicz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John A Zychowicz was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • John A Zychowicz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges by the end of his probation; civil judgment if not paid.

*NO Contact with firearms.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*Complete batterer's intervention program.
*Attend parenting classes.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.addlTxt:
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
cab

Defendant John A Zychowicz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
The parties are back in court for the sentencing.
Hearing continued....
.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statement by:  Sarah T.
As to counts 1 and 3:
 Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, as to count 1 and 30 days in the House of Correction as to count 3,  with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years as to each count, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for placement with his children.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges by the end of his probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Have DNA swab and pay DNA.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John A Zychowicz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a trial today.  The defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued...
.
As to counts 1 and 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed.
Case adjourned for sentencing to the p.m.
.

Defendant John A Zychowicz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 36 on 08/24/2015 at 8:30am.  State rescinded their offer. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Jury trial on August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John A Zychowicz NOT in court, appearance waived, with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at request of branch 36. Matter set for Final Pretrial on 8/11/2015. Branch 36 is not in session on that date. Court VACATED final pretrial date, and reset matter for Final Pretrial before branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John A Zychowicz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement made by Desiree H.  requesting modification of the no contact order.  Court modifies the no contact order to a no violent contact order and orders that the couple may not reside togther.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Motions to be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John A Zychowicz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Case before the court at request of the state to address the No Contact Order. Statements by Desiree H. Court modified the No Contact Order to allow for contact between the defendant and Desiree H. and her children between the hours of 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM from Monday to Friday only under supervision of Irene G., supervised contact at during this time must be NON-VIOLENT. All other aspects of the no contact order remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for previously scheduled Pretrial Conference on 5/1/2015 at 8:30 AM.

15RM020211  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/17/2015
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SARAH T. and her children;  DESIREE H. and her children.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John A Zychowicz in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant John A Zychowicz in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
